quote_first: This is the evening. This is the night. It is New Year´s Eve.
quote_last: I still have twenty-eight minutes left. I have to recollect my thoughts. At twelve o´clock, I should be done thinking.
quote_time_case: In about twenty-eight minutes it will be midnight.
quote_raw: This is the evening. This is the night. It is New Year´s Eve. In about twenty-eight minutes it will be midnight. I still have twenty-eight minutes left. I have to recollect my thoughts. At twelve o´clock, I should be done thinking.
title: The Evenings
author: Gerard Reve

quote_first:
And then it started to rain and I got wet and I started shivering because I was cold.
And then it was
quote_last:
and I heard voices of people walking along the street.
And a voice said, "I don't care whether you thought it was funny or not," and it was a lady's voice.
quote_raw:
And then it started to rain and I got wet and I started shivering because I was cold.
And then it was 11.32 p.m. and I heard voices of people walking along the street.
And a voice said, "I don't care whether you thought it was funny or not," and it was a lady's voice.
title: The Curious Incident of the Dog in the Night-Time
author: Mark Haddon
